title: What would happen if Apple buys Samsung? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which Samsung do you propose Apple buy? Do you mean Samsung Electronics, or Samsumg C&T, or Samsung Life Insurance, or… Let's assume Apple wants to buy Samsung electronics (since buying the entire Samsung group would practically be impossible). Then the South Korean government would disallow the purchase, since Samsung is a major part of the Korean economy. Many other governments would also have problems with the purchase since it would possibly result in an Apple monopoly. So it's practically impossible for Apple to buy Samsung. But let’s assume somehow Apple did buy Samsung (Electronics). Apple would then be: the biggest DRAM producer in the worldthe biggest smartphone manufacturer in the worldthe biggest AMOLED display manufacturer in the worldthe biggest SSD manufacturer in the worldApple would also have access to these products RefrigeratorsMicrowave ovensA/CAir purifiersTVsAudio devices (AKG/Harman Kardon)Semiconductors (SSDs, RAM, etc)Samsung's semiconductor processing facility (meaning that Apple can directly mass produce CPUs & other products using Samsung's 5nm/7nm/etc process)Home securityCameras & recording devicesMedical devicesNetworking tech (CDMA/5G/etc)IoTVRSoftware (Samsung browser, DeX, Knox, SmartThings, Samsung pay, etc)It would make Apple into a giant company, hence why the government probably won't allow it.
